description: When a Rhapsody user attempts to play a song, Rhapsody uses an RMA file to check whether the user's computer is authorized to play that song. This is how Rhapsody performs Digital Rights Management ( DRM ). Rhapsody's DRM also prevents users from sharing downloaded music with others.
RMA files are often confused with .RM , .RA , and .RAM files, which are also RealNetworks files. However, those file types are associated with RealPlayer media, not Rhapsody.
NOTE: In 2016, RealNetworks rebranded Rhapsody as Napster. It is unknown whether Napster still uses RMA files to perform DRM functions.
